Halt to suppression of Hanchongryon demanded
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity for the Implementation of the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and Peace on the Korean Peninsula reportedly issued a statement on May 6, denouncing the security authorities for suppressing the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon).
 At a time when the north-south ministerial talks are being held amid the complicated situation of the Korean Peninsula, giving a bright future to the Korean people, the security authorities are intensifying crackdown on the members of Hanchongryon who have stood in the van of the reunification movement, the statement said, adding: this is an overall challenge to the desire of the nation for reunification.    
 Severely protesting against the arrest of deputies to Hanchongryon and sentence of penal servitude on them, the statement demanded the security authorities release all the detained students affiliated with Hanchongryon.
